column4: I need some help throwing commands to the background, so they don't give me a verbose output, and I can keep giving commands...
It's still throwing out output...
O.O!
Thank you!
Didn't think to send it to null...
or a file if you might want to inspect it later
depending on the app,  alt-f2 <command> will do also
he wasn't talking to you, a bad joke. testx rm -rf is never a joking matter in this channel ;)
I know that's not a joking matter!  Which, is why I got concerned when he said it!
which ones aren't installing?
did you reboot after the ati site driver install?
with ati site driver 8.3, don't use xgl
xserver-xgl that is, it's not needed since 8.3 has aiglx support
but before you do anything else, put a copy of /var/log/Xorg.0.log on http://paste.ubuntu-nl.org
for some reason, you're not using the fglrx driver but the open source radeon driver.  edit /etc/X11/xorg.conf , find the driver section and change 'ati' to 'fglrx'
oh yes you do
if you are absolutely sure, sudo dpkg-reconfigure -pcritical xserver-xorg will build a default, then make the edit I gave
mine has never disappeared, no.   do    ls /etc/X11  (make sure you get the caps right)
you ran something called driconf? Never heard of it
never used it, no opinion on it
sudo do-release-upgrade
